intro: Senecio mustersii, commonly known as the desert groundsels, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Senecio mustersii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, playing a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
